page.title: 03THE CLIMATE OF WEST CAMBS.
page.content:
The range of temperatures in the area is one of the most extreme in the country. Summers are warm, with maximum temperatures in July averaging 22 deg.C, but night frosts occur from September until May, often making side roads treacherous in winter. Snow generally falls for about one week per year, with drifts sometimes causing problems on exposed stretches of road.
The prevailing south-westerly winds have less effect so far East, and this makes the area drier and less windy than most of the country. Fogs are common in autumn and winter, although less severe than in the river valleys to the North and South of the area.
